title: Show HN: Generate Anki cards from your notes
text:
Hi!

To help me prepare for a biology test, I made a Python app, using the excellent genanki package[1] to generate Anki cards directly from my Markdown notes. Cards are created from list items, using delimeters like `?::` to separate the question/answer (or front/back) from one another.

Example:

---

# The Solar System

- Number of planets ?:: 8

## Planets

- Mars

  - Color ?:: red
---

This will create two cards:

(1)

Path: The Solar System

Front: Number of planets

Back: 8

(2)

Path: The Solar System > Planets > Mars

Front: Color

Back: Red

Other tools to generate Anki cards from Markdown exist, but none worked well with nested lists. I also really wanted to have a "path", generated from headings/ancestral list items, to enable very succint cards, such as the `Color ?:: red`.

I hope it might be of use to someone else.

[1] https://github.com/kerrickstaley/genanki

Show HN: CSS minifier implemented in dependency-free C
text:
cssminc is a CSS (Cascading Style Sheet) minifier implemented as a tiny, dependency-free, C89-compliant library which can read CSS from arbitrary sources (via a callback) and emit it in minified form to an arbitrary destination (via a callback).

Its library-level code is only 2 files (one header, one implementation) and it includes an optional CLI app which demonstrates how it's used.

title: Is there an equivalent of YC's SAFE doc for royalties, musicians and creators?
text:
I am looking for a standard, relatively fair document that is easy to understand that can help musicians and creators manage royalties, endorsements, promotions etc.

The SAFE from YC kind of does this for funding rounds for entrepreneurs.

Some cases that I am looking at use cases for these docs would be: 1) A musician/creator having their work used in films, commercials etc 2) A creator endorsing, promoting or advertising a brand 3) A creator using a bigger channel to push their content, i.e. creator gives their work to a larger channel with distribution 4) An artist signing with a label 5) An artist performing at an event 6) An artist becoming a brand ambassador 7) A creator's residuals

I wouldn't expect all these to have one universal doc. I actually think they would be individual docs.

I think what I am looking for is a doc that highlights in simple terms all the important stuff when signing such contracts in somewhat easy to understand language. Terms would obviously be flexible and determined between parties but the doc should have all the terms that need to be addressed at the very least and have them clearly explained.

Any assistance with this would be greatly appreciated

Are there any open source or CLI vectorizers as good as Vector Magic?
text: I've been looking at PNG-to-SVG tools and Vector Magic's quality is amazing. The only problem is it's a web / Windows / Mac-only app and I'm looking for something I can run programatically on a large collection of images. Having trouble finding one that works - any suggestions?
